title: Determinant of 2x2 Matrix
text: The determinant of a 2×2 matrix, given $$A=\begin{bmatrix} a & b \\ c & d \end{bmatrix}$$ \\n is defined as $$det(A)=a d-c b$$. \\n Notice the change in notation. There are several ways to indicate the determinant, including det(A) and replacing the brackets in a matrix with straight lines, |A|.

title: Finding the Determinant
text: Apply the formula that $$det(A)=a d-b c$$, what is the determinant?\n##figure1.gif##
